why-ai.caption: Why AI on the Blockchain?
why-ai.title: Solana is built for scale — a blockchain with low costs, high speeds, minimal energy impact, and easy user experience. AI could reduce that friction even further, opening up the power of decentralization to millions of people by making it even easier to use.

card-1.title: Solana Agent Kit
card-1.content: SendAI's Solana Agent Kit is the toolkit to connect any AI Agent to 30+ Solana Protocols and perform 50+ Solana Actions, compatible with Eliza, Langchain, Perplexity, and Vercel AI SDK.

card-2.title: Eliza
card-2.content: ElizaOS is a simple, fast, and lightweight Typescript AI agent framework, with Solana protocol integrations, Twitter integration, and more.

card-3.title: Rig
card-3.content: Rig is a Rust framework to build portable, modular & lightweight Fullstack Agents. Multiple Solana integrations available along with the rig agent kit, the Solana Swiss Army Knife.

card-4.title: GOAT
card-4.content: Goat, the Great Onchain Agent Tookit by Crossmint, is an open-source framework for connecting AI agents to any onchain app. Built for use with all wallets, including Crossmint Smart Wallets and Coinbase wallets.

card-5.title: Zerepy
card-5.content: ZerePy is a Python framework to build, customize, and deploy agents capable of social and onchain actions on Solana.

validators.title: Validators: Help Secure the Network and Earn SOL
validators.description: The Solana Mainnet Beta network is currently supported by 1,000+ independent validators and can support transaction throughput of up to 50k TPS with sub-second confirmation times. Learn more about joining the ecosystem as a validator to start earning SOL rewards.
validators.sub-header: Decentralize the network by providing computing resources.

cards.number-text: Current number of validators on mainnet

definition.title: Validators form the backbone of Solana’s network.
definition.text: By processing transactions and participating in consensus, each validator helps make Solana the most censorship resistant and highest-performance blockchain network in the world.

cards.protocol-text: Issuances from a global, protocol-defined, inflation rate. These rewards are delivered on top of earnings from transaction fees.
cards.staking-text: Stakers are rewarded for helping to validate the ledger. They do this by delegating their stake to validator nodes. Those validators do the legwork of replaying the ledger and send votes to a per-node vote account to which stakers can delegate their stakes. The rest of the cluster uses those stake-weighted votes to select a block when forks arise.
cards.stake-pool-text: Stake Pools are a liquid staking solution that promote censorship resistance, decentralization, and the growth of DeFi on Solana.

cards.docs-text: Go here for documentation related to all things Validator, from validator requirements, to troubleshooting.
cards.explorer-text: View the current list of validators, their ranking by stake amount, and information about commission below.
cards.education-text: The Solana Validator Education is a 2 part series on important Solana validator concepts and the steps needed to get a new validator setup.
cards.delegation-text: Foundation Delegation participants are eligible to receive a delegation from the Solana Foundation.

callout-1.title: Solana Wallets Are How You Experience <gradient>the Power of Solana</gradient>
callout-1.subtitle: Use a wallet to send money around the world, buy and sell tokens, open loans, stake tokens and earn interest, collect NFTs, play games, and more.

multisig.title: Multisig Wallets: Distributed, Customizable Control
multisig.subtitle-1: Key benefit of enhanced security with multiple signers and flexible wallet configurations
multisig.subtitle-2: Perfect for collectively managed organizations (DAOs, pooled funds) and escrow services requiring shared control

see-more.title: See more
see-more.text: Multisig wallets use multiple keys to share control, ensuring no single party can access funds. They're perfect for DAOs, treasuries, or any group needing collective decision-making.

custodial.title: Custodial Wallets: Simplified and Regulated
subtitle: Key benefit of ease of use and account recovery, and regulatory oversight.
Perfect for institutions requiring compliance oversight and users that prioritize convenience over control.

see-more.title: See more
text: Custodial wallets let a third party manage private keys, offering the ease of traditional banking and recourse for lost funds without the need to manage keys yourself.

With a custodial wallet, a third party custodian holds the keys to your wallet. This gives you a simplified experience by abstracting away gas fees, keys storage, and web3 complexities. Similar to a traditional bank account, a custodian takes on the risk and burden of wallet security—but in return, you give up control, allowing the custodian to approve transactions and move your funds.
Custodial wallets are great for non-technical users, users who don’t want to worry about security, and corporate entities with compliance concerns.

non-custodial.title: Non-Custodial Wallets: Absolute Ownership and Control
subtitle: Key benefit of full control and privacy over funds and censorship-resistant with no third-party involvement.
Perfect for organizations requiring full asset autonomy users familiar with private key management.

see-more.title: See more
text: Non-custodial wallets give users full control of their keys and funds, ensuring privacy and security. However, if keys are lost, there's no recourse.

With non-custodial wallets, you hold the keys to the wallet and are responsible for its safety and security. In return, you retain full control, giving you a wallet that is private, censorship resistant, and accessible only by you. However, if your keys are lost or stolen, you lose access to everything in your wallet—with no recourse.
Non-custodial wallets are great for advanced users and users with privacy and censorship worries.Additionally, non-custodial wallets can be of two subcategories:

Software wallets are browser extensions or apps on your phone. They are always connected to the internet, convenient, and easy to use. They are great for fast access, mobile phone payments, and daily use.

Hardware wallets are stand-alone physical devices (often similar to USB drives). To approve a transaction, you connect the hardware wallet to the internet (via your computer) and give approvals. While hardware wallets can be cumbersome, they add an important layer of security against hacks and stolen keys.

details.title: Wallet Safety Tips
details.subtitle: Keep your wallet safe with these tips:

items.title: Protect your seed phrase
items.text: Non-custodial wallets come with a seed phrase, which grants full access to everything in that wallet. Safely store this seed phrase offline, never share it with anyone else, and avoid storing it on your computer or in the cloud where it can be hacked.

items.title: Don’t blindly click links and always double-check URLs
items.text: Scam links are the main cause of wallet hacks, so don't click links from DMs, emails, or social media posts without verifying their URLs against official sources—especially if a site asks to connect with your wallet. Even links sent from "trusted" sources may come from compromised accounts.

items.title: Use a password manager
items.text: Your passwords should be complex and unique for every account. Use a password manager that generates unique, strong passwords and stores them securely.

items.title: Use common sense
items.text: No one is sending you free ETH or Bitcoin. Tech support is probably not going to comment on your X post. The CEO of a large crypto company is not going to DM you. Be vigilant.

nft-showdown.title: The Solana NFT Showdown
nft-showdown.description: The Solana Foundation is calling all creators to bring their business ideas to life in this one-of-a-kind NFT pitch competition.
nft-showdown.alert: Join the NFT Showdown - Build the next generation of NFT brands on Solana ->

intro.title: Introducing
intro.heading: The Solana NFT Showdown
intro.lead: Fostering the next generation of NFT brands
intro.description-1: Prepare for a showdown of epic proportions! The Solana Foundation is calling all creators to bring their business ideas to life in this one-of-a-kind NFT pitch competition – a rare opportunity to have the chance to collaborate with industry experts and NFT community leaders. We’re seeking new Solana NFT brands that aim to create real-world products in verticals such as fashion, entertainment, gaming, creative agencies.
intro.description-2: NFT brands are a great way for savvy entrepreneurs to kickstart their business plans and build lasting communities. Do you have a creative concept and business pitch you’re passionate about? Take advantage of this chance to access and leverage a variety of new Solana tools that provide flexibility and scale. Project winners will be selected based on their viable business plans and the product innovation they showcase – working with judges who will provide guidance to give you the knowledge you need to turn your vision into a reality.
intro.description-3: It’s time to make this a pitch fit for the boardroom. Drop your email below to stay in-the-know on updates and timing. The submission window will be open in early June. Get started on those pitches and good luck!
intro.description-4: For complete pitch guidelines, see the FAQs below.

prizes.title: Prizes
prizes.description: Finalists and winners will all receive
list: Mentorship and office hours with the Solana team.
Attendance to curated workshops hosted by industry experts and NFT community leaders.
Tickets to Breakpoint, scheduled from Oct. 30 - Nov. 3, 2023 in Amsterdam.

judging.title: Judging
judging.description-1: Project winners will be selected based on their viable business plans and the product innovation they showcase – business acumen, user-centric product thinking, creative direction, innovative use of Solana tech, and real-world application will all play a factor in identifying the winning submissions.
judging.description-2: Judges will narrow entries down to ten finalists. From there, in partnership with their mentor, finalists will present their pitch in-person. Of the ten finalists, a total of five NFT projects will be recognized as winners.

disclaimer.rules: SOLANA Foundation NFT Showdown Official Rules
disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.description-line-1: The Solana NFT Showdown is a competition where projects will be evaluated by judges on their business acumen, user-centric product thinking, creative direction and lore, innovative use of Solana technology, and real-world application without consideration of legal viability. All participants must comply with applicable laws and regulations in connection with their projects for the NFT Showdown.
disclaimer.description-line-2: The developer resources that Solana Foundation (“SF”) provides are for educational and inspirational purposes only. SF does not encourage, induce or sanction the deployment of any such applications in violation of applicable laws or regulations. SF does not encourage, induce or sanction the deployment, integration or use of any such applications (including the code comprising the Solana blockchain protocol) in violation of applicable laws or regulations and hereby prohibits any such deployment, integration or use. This includes use of any such applications by the reader (a) in violation of export control or sanctions laws of the United States or any other applicable jurisdiction, (b) if the reader is located in or ordinarily resides in a country or territory subject to comprehensive sanctions administered by the U.S. Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), (c) if the reader is or is working on behalf of a Specially Designated National (SDN) or is a person subject to similar blocking or denied party prohibitions, or (d) in violation of the Commodities and Exchange Act.

meta.title: Only possible on Solana
meta.description: Developers from around the world are building apps on Solana for a fast, secure, scalable, and user-friendly future. A future that's only possible on Solana. Explore resources, connect to the ecosystem, and get building.

hero.title: Built for what's possible.
hero.description: Developers from around the world are building apps on Solana for a fast, secure, scalable, and user-friendly future. A future that's only possible on Solana. Explore resources, connect to the ecosystem, and get building.

case-1.title: Hivemapper is mapping the world with everyday drivers.
case-1.description: Hivemapper's community has already mapped 6% of the world's roads, with weekly rewards powered by Solana’s unparalleled state compression technology.

case-2.title: Helium Mobile enables community-powered 5G service.
case-2.description: Helium migrated to Solana, bringing a “People’s Network” to a growing number of American cities.

case-3.title: The Drip team has dropped 25-million artworks for around $3,000.
case-3.description: Using state compression, Drip has distributed quality artworks every week, for free, to a user base of 400k and counting.

case-4.title: Dialect has minted by the millions with 2,400 to 24,000x cheaper minting costs.
case-4.description: Dialect dramatically lowered minting costs to let users share NFT stickers on a mass scale with compressed NFTs on Solana.

case-5.title: So far, GainForest has monitored 5.4m hectares of land for environmental conservation.
case-5.description: GainForest uses Solana smart contracts to collect real-time data and incentivize reforestation efforts worldwide.

innovations.title: Discover what’s only possible with Solana’s tech stack

mint.title: Mint by the millions
mint.description1: With state compression for NFTs, the cost of high-volume drops just got a lot cheaper. Imagine onboarding new users en masse or rewarding existing users for just a few hundred dollars, instead of a few hundred thousand. From event ticketing, to collectibles, to social media stickers and more, compressed NFTs open up a whole new world of possibilities.
mint.description2: This is made possible by <docsLink>state compression</docsLink>, a technique in which transaction data secured by the Solana ledger is hashed and verified against a Merkle tree account for use in a smart contract. This means that compressed NFTs can be created onchain in a similar manner as before, but for a fraction of the cost.

scale.title: Tech that scales, ultra fast
scale.description1: With Solana’s native scalability, you don’t need to make a tradeoff between decentralization and performance. Whether you’re building the <gamingLink>next big thing in gaming</gamingLink>, or focused on frontiers like AI or decentralized physical infrastructure (dePIN), let your imagination run wild and build the kind of application that’s only possible on Solana.
scale.description2: Ground-breaking projects like <heliumLink>Helium</heliumLink> and <hivemapperLink>Hivemapper</hivemapperLink> are building what’s only possible on Solana, thanks to its transaction speeds, scalability and reliability. And with integrations in <aiLink>areas such as AI</aiLink>, builders on Solana have access to the latest innovations to fuel their most ambitious projects.

climate.title: Climate-conscious tech
climate.description1: On Solana, a blockchain transaction uses about the <environmentLink>same amount of energy as a few online searches</environmentLink>. And with <emissionsLink>real-time emissions measurement</emissionsLink>, you can be sure you’re building on tech that not only performs, but is committed to energy efficiency.
climate.description2: The emissions tracker software embedded directly on Solana nodes provides comprehensive and dynamic measurements over time. This data set is detail-rich, open, and free to use, making it possible for validators or anyone building on Solana to evaluate their contributions to the network’s carbon footprint and explore mitigation strategies.

payment.title: Power global payments
payment.description1: Solana’s high throughput and low fees make it possible to support <paymentsLink>decentralized payments</paymentsLink> at scale. And with <solanapayLink>Solana Pay</solanapayLink>, developers have the toolkit they need to integrate Wall-Street-fast payment capabilities into their apps, while providing auditability and confidentiality when they need it most. Now your project or business can harness the power of the blockchain at the same speed as traditional payment networks, without intermediaries.
payment.description2: With Solana, builders have the opportunity to create the next generation of merchant payment and commerce rails built on blockchain technology that provides low cost and instant settlement for online and in-store payments. Find new ways to incentivize your customers with onchain rewards and loyalty offerings, and work directly with your customer – no intermediaries needed.

web3.title: Web3 in your pocket
web3.description1: With <solanaMobileLink>Solana Mobile</solanaMobileLink>, web3 in your pocket is finally here. When you combine a world-class crypto phone, mobile dApp store and mobile stack, all underpinned by fast and secure blockchain tech, the possibilities are endless.
web3.description2: The Saga phone by Solana Mobile is ushering in the new mobile era of web3. Not only does it have the premium hardware you expect from your phone, but with its one-of-a-kind dApp store you can access your favorite DeFi protocols, NFT marketplaces and web3 apps on the go. Plus, with the phone’s secure Seed Vault, you can securely transact with your favorite wallet, protect your private keys and sign transactions using just your fingerprint.

custodial.text: Custodial wallets let a third party manage private keys, offering the ease of traditional banking and recourse for lost funds without the need to manage keys yourself.

non-custodial.text: Non-custodial wallets give users full control of their keys and funds, ensuring privacy and security. However, if keys are lost, there's no recourse.

multisig.text: Multisig wallets use multiple keys to share control, ensuring no single party can access funds. They’re perfect for DAOs, treasuries, or any group needing collective decision-making.

callout-2.title: Make Money <gradient>Do More</gradient>

meta.title: Token Extensions
meta.description: Using token extensions built in collaboration with large institutions, new token standards unlock rich native functionality designed for complex behaviors without compromising on security or scalability. Businesses can get started today.

hero.text: Regulatory compliance and enterprise customization with no security trade-offs.

confidential-balances.title: Confidential Balances
confidential-balances.text: Enable private transactions by allowing transfers between users without revealing amounts, ensuring financial privacy.

transfer-fees.title: Transfer Fees
transfer-fees.text: Implement fees for each transfer that are automatically sent to a designated account, creating new revenue models and tokenized incentives.

mint-close-authority.title: Mint Close Authority
mint-close-authority.text: Allow token issuers to close mint accounts, reclaim resources, and maintain control over token supply.

interest-bearing.title: Interest-Bearing Tokens
interest-bearing.text: Assign interest rates to tokens and display accumulated interest for financial products or savings instruments.

non-transfer.title: Non-Transferable Tokens
non-transfer.text: Restrict token transfers for added user exclusivity and permanence, to build user loyalty and value.

permanent-delegate.title: Permanent Delegate
permanent-delegate.text: Designate a permanent account delegate for specific mint activities, ensuring ongoing oversight and control.

transfer-hook.title: Transfer Hook
transfer-hook.text: Trigger custom programs on each token transfer to integrate advanced business logic or compliance checks.

metadata.title: Metadata and Metadata Pointer
metadata.text: The metadata pointer links a token mint to a metadata account, while the mint extension embeds metadata directly into mint accounts.

group-pointer.title: Group and Group Pointer
group-pointer.text: Organize tokens into groups and designate group accounts to simplify management and categorization.

member-pointer.title: Member and Member Pointer
member-pointer.text: Define group member configurations and relationships, for collective governance or co-creation features.

memo-required.title: Memo Required on Transfer
memo-required.text: Ensure documentation and audit trails by requiring memos on each token transfer, for financial reporting and more.

immutable-owner.title: Immutable Owner
immutable-owner.text: Lock down token ownership to prevent unauthorized transfers to ensure verifiable security and trust.

default-account.title: Default Account State
default-account.text: Automatically freeze new token accounts that can be re-activated through specific user interactions.

cpi-guard.title: CPI Guard
cpi-guard.text: Control which programs can interact with your token, mitigating the risk of unauthorized access and operation.

reallocate.title: Reallocate
reallocate.text: Allow token holders to adjust account settings post-creation, in response to changing enterprise or market demands.

q1.question: What are token extensions?
q1.answer: Token extensions are new token program-level features, enabled by the new open-source token minting program available on the Solana blockchain. Token extensions enable the next generation of features for digital assets and stablecoins on the Solana blockchain by imbuing the assets with a native set of rich features ranging from confidentiality to token-gated access to required metadata. Assets minted using this program can bring to life the promise of true programmability of money and assets on the blockchain

q2.question: How is this different from Token-2022?
q2.answer: Token-2022 is the technical name and GitHub repository for the new SPL token program, as released by Solana Labs. Token extensions, on the other hand, are what the new token standard enables. Think of them as a list of new features and functions that can now function at the token program level.

q3.question: What are the benefits of using token extensions versus the legacy Solana token standard?

answer.p1: Token-2022 is the technical name and GitHub repository for the new SPL token program, as released by Solana Labs. Token extensions, on the other hand, are what the new token standard enables. Think of them as a list of new features and functions that can now function at the token program level.
answer.p2: A few examples of what is possible natively with token extensions:
answer.l1: Confidential transfers: The ability to mask token balances and the amounts of token transfers, with auditability from the issuer of the token
answer.l2: Token gated transfers: The ability to control which wallets can receive tokens based on KYC identifiers
answer.l3: Transfer Fees: The issuer of the token can charge transfer fees to assist in monetization of transactions
answer.l4: Required metadata: Metadata about transfers can be mandatory, allowing payment attribution data to be bound to the transaction itself.
answer.p3: There are several other extensions that enable additional rich functionality for digital asset issuers.

q4.question: Are tokens minted using token extensions backwards compatible with dApps that support Solana tokens today?
q4.answer: Tokens minted with token extensions belong to a new protocol. While the protocol is backwards compatible with the existing SPL Token standard, dApps must be upgraded to handle tokens minted with specific extensions.

q5.question: Have token extensions been audited?
q5.answer: Yes, the program has gone through 5 audits from the following security firms: Halborn, Zellic, NCC, Trail of Bits, and OtterSec.

q6.question: Are there examples of stablecoins or digital assets that have been created using this new token standard?
q6.answer: There are several projects about to launch RWA and stablecoins using this program. Paxos recently launched USDP on Solana leveraging token extensions, GMO Trust plans to launch a regulated stablecoin and several other major enterprises are planning on launching throughout the course of 2024.

q7.question: Can I use multiple extensions?
q7.answer: Yes — however, some combinations are not yet ready to work in tandem. For example, transfer hooks and confidential transfers do not currently work together. For that particular case, a fix is being developed and can be tracked <0>here</0>.

q8.question: Are all of the extensions available today?
q8.answer: With the exception of confidential transfers, all of the extensions are available for use today. Confidential transfers will be available once version 2.0 of the core Agave validator client is released and has been adopted by the network, which is expected to happen by EOY 2024.

q9.question: Can the program used for transfer hooks / permanent mint delegation be changed after mint initialization?
q9.answer: Yes! As long as the requisite authority is reserved, the program used for both or either of those extensions can be updated to new PDAs.

q10.question: Can I create the destination ATA for a confidential transfer?
q10.answer: While you can create the destination ATA for public transfers, the owner of that account needs to set up an encryption key, thus meaning that the owner must configure their account to accept confidential transfers before receiving confidential transfers.

q11.question: Can multiple auditors be set for the confidential transfer authority?
q11.answer: No. Only a single ElGamal public key (derivable from an ed25519 private key) can be set, and without a fancy key-sharing implementation that single key is the only one capable of auditing transfer amounts.
